climbs.name: You Dropped a Bolt on Me, Baby.

content.description: This route shares a start with Ring My Bell.  At the roof it breaks right up into the large hueco.  Cross the hueco on large but strenuous undercling holds and the continue up the steep, crimpy face to the right to the chains.  Clip the longer perm-draw on the lower off to clean the route easily.
content.location: This is the first route you come to on the approach to Soul Train.

content.description: This route goes up the steep face directly above the trail.  It shares a start with You Dropped a Bolt on Me, Baby.  The crux is where this route goes left across the steepest section of the face.  You'll have to commit to some less than stellar feet to move across to large jug cobbles.  Above this section the climbing remains steep but soon eases off to a slabbier angle.  Follow the bolts to the namesake chains on the left.
content.location: After climbing the hand line to the trail that runs along the base of the crag you'll quickly come to a line of bolts at the steepest section of the route.  Ring My Bell takes the first few bolts and then breaks left.

content.description: Move up and right after the first bolt until under the obvious steep section, which is the crux.  From here follow the bolts gently left and up to the chains.
content.location: Starts on the same pillar as Don Cornelius and moves right at the first bolt.

content.description: This is the farthest left route at Soul Train.  Start at the bolt just before the end of the base trail.

Follow the line of bolts up and left from the start pillar.  The crux is on the large overlap at mid height, and the finish to the top is thin.  It is possible to skip the final two bolts and descend from the chains for Midnight Train to Echo.
content.location: Start down slope from Midnight Train to Echo, at the pillar right of a huge cobble.

content.description: The right facing dihedral is loose so stay to the right of the line of bolts. The technical crux is getting off the ledge at mid height.  The head crux is two bolts after that.  You'll have to search for the key holds, especially the only sinker finger lock at Echo.
content.location: Just after the end of the hand lines is a right facing corner with a prow sticking out right above.  Climb the black streaked rock to the right.  You can belay from either the chains directly under the route or the set to the left. The former offers a better view but you are in the line of fire. The latter is safer but it’s harder to see the leader.

content.description: Follow the line of bolts up and left with a careful step onto the rock above the mid-height ledge.  The first bolt is a bit higher than usual for Echo but don’t reach for that stick clip just yet, the climbing to it is only 5.6.  Care should be taken above the mid-height ledge to avoid injury.
content.location: Look for the first bolt slightly higher in the black streak beneath the mid-height ledge.

content.description: Crux is where the wall steepens at mid height.
content.location: Starts below the right end of a thin slit in the wall about 20 feet up.
